verses.roman:
siṁha-dvāre gābhī-āge sei bhāta ḍāre
saḍā-gandhe tailaṅgī-gāi khāite nā pāre

synonyms: siṁha-dvāre—at the gate known as Siṁha-dvāra; gābhī-āge—in front of the cows; sei bhāta—that food; ḍāre—they throw; saḍā-gandhe—because of a rotten smell; tailaṅgī-gāi—the cows from Tailaṅga; khāite nā pāre—cannot eat.
translation: All the decomposed food is thrown before the cows from Tailaṅga at the Siṁha-dvāra gate. Because of its rotten odor, even the cows cannot eat it.
